page.title: 07FORESTRY CONTINUED
page.content: Delamere/Eddisbury {FORESTRY CONTINUED} Deciduous trees line the main roads which run through the forest.Trees such as Sweet chestnut,oak & beech act as windbreaks,provide wildlife habitats,& make a more attractive screen along the roadsides.Replanting is under way to replace these broad- leaved trees as they decay & die back. Delamere has a wide range of timber crops from mature stands containing logs of sawmilling standard,down to new plantings.The forest produces a constant yield & the main crops are Corsican pine & Scots pine.The crops are represented by the following ages, 1-30yrs old 45%,31-60yrs old 31%,over 60yrs old 24%.Annual timber production is 470 lorry loads or 8000m3.65% is sent to sawmills,25% for newsprint at Shotton on the Dee, & 10% is firewood.
